caption:
This photograph captures a scene on a two-lane highway during what appears to be either early morning or late afternoon, judging by the low light levels and the long shadows. The road is wet, possibly from recent rain, adding a reflective sheen to the tarmac. In the foreground on the right, a vintage pickup truck, identifiable as a Ford from the visible lettering on its tailgate, is driving away from the camera. The truck is light-colored and features distinct, rounded body lines typical of truck designs from the mid-20th century.

On the left side of the image, slightly blurred due to motion, is a van moving towards the viewer. The van is darker in color and contrasts with the wet, shimmering road. Above the road, electrical lines stretch across the scene, connecting to utility poles that line the roadside. Further down the road, the scene fades into a hazy, mist-like atmosphere, which suggests either fog or a dusty environment, adding a sense of depth and distance.

The surrounding landscape includes dense vegetation on both sides of the highway, hinting at a rural or semi-rural locale. The overall mood of the image is somewhat somber and quiet, emphasized by the muted tones and the absence of bright sunlight.
title: View of clear creek road at the schold road turnoff.  This spot is near the proposed site for a "new city" to be created for the projected 27,000 people who will move into the area when the navy's proposed trident submarine base is built nearby.  The population growth will affect many communities in the vicinity
